text: I have been coming here since the early 90's and it is exactly the same great food every time !

The service has never been great but what can you expect at a place like this. Tacos used to be amazing though. I was here a week a go and was extremely disappointed Bad service, horrible and expensive tacos. Will not be going here again.
This place is filthy am surprised that the city hasn't shut their doors for violating city codes. The washrooms are disgusting.

I can't speak on their other menu items but their carne asada steak burrito is literally within the top 5 best burritos I've had in my life, if not the best burrito of my life. Granted, I chose the supreme version, which is $12 --super pricey for a burrito, but damn it was good.  Evenings are pretty busy, especially on a Friday night like when I went.
The best Taco , Burito & Chachos in town .. Always pack but its worth waiting for good stuffs
Just had a relleno taco--heaven. Restaurant is a bit dumpy, but that taco was so delicious! And service was fast and friendly.

Came here for tacos on a bit of a whim on a Thursday afternoon, not my favorite place for tacos but not terrible either. Atmosphere- It was pretty dead given it was a Thursday at 4pm but I can imagine the place gets packed at certain times. Service- Very speedy. I only ordered two tacos to stay and they were ready in 2 minutes. Food- I had one chile relleno taco and one carne asada. The carne asada one was decent. The chile relleno one I would not recommend. It tasted like fish and I suspect that it was likely microwaved or had been out for some time. Might be better as a late night spot but there are better tacos out there!
Best burrito that I've had in Chicago thus far.  Having this blocks away should be illegal...lol
Local quick service taco / burrito spot.  My go to is 3 of the steak tacos with cilantro and onion.  Great place to grab a quick bite from on the way home.

Horribly overpriced for Mexican food. A Steak burrito without cheese... is $10...for cheese .60. If you wanna try the salsa negra....50cents otherwise you'll only have green salsa available to you. With all that being said the flavor is mediocre at best nothing fancy at all...$3.00 tacos with cheese..$3.60...ridiculously overpriced...The hype is not real...#notgoodmexican
I forgot how much this place sucks when there is no manager on duty, the girls cop an attitude and it takes 20 minutes 2 tostadas

As they say, they are the best tacos in town, but since they closed the larger store next door, they jacked their prices, started charging for the dark colored salsa, and the counter service is frankly unpleasant. This is my first time around in several years. I won't be coming back.
Used to be the best; now it's greasy and kinda sucks.  They microwave which is a turn off as well.

Terrible customer service! I went there for my Lunch break. When I get back to work the over priced guacamole was spoiled and completely black and chips were old and hard as a rock. When I call to get a new batch delivered or a refund. I was treated horribly by a girl named Cindy who claim she was the owner and which is why she can get away with treating people like crap. I will never spend another dollar here, or any one of their other locations. The place is filthy and the people that work there need a attitude adjustment.

its sad to see what happen to this place. i loved going here years ago. it was my favorite restaurant. the tacos and green salsa were the best. when i moves back to wicker park all i can think is eating here. i went 2 days ago and man was i disappointed the prices went up and the food is not what it use to be. wont be coming back here.
Great place for late night eats! They accept cash or card now, but be prepared to wait in line to order food. I love their old school Mexican rice as well as their tostadas!

Horrible!! Gross and expensive! Never coming back.  The steaks tacos used to cost 1.50 to now a ridiculously high price of 3 dollars plus taxes . They didn't even change the size! They are the same micro tacos and they don't taste as good as they used to, very sad. We were huge fans of this place . The guacamole is gross , the small size is as big as the cups that you can use at Wendy's to get ketchup, that's and insult!! and guac is made with old ingredients and it tastes horrible the chips are very bland and old too. If you raise your prices more than 3% it is obvious you have to improve a lot of your food quality and the place . But In this case you did the opposite, you raised the prices too high, you lowered tremendously the quality of the food and you didn't make any improvements in your restaurant area it remain the same if not even more dirty and old. Finally something else that bothers us a lot is that you are  basically the only restaurant in Chicago that for every purchase for 5 dollars or more by debit or credit card you have to  ask for an ID . you're not selling jewelry, designer clothes or anything close .. not even Michelin star restaurant ask for an ID is a bit annoying.
Service has gone down. I would rather take my business elsewhere. Today we were given the wrong order and chips were not fresh. Cashier was really rude and unprofessional.

The steak was AMAZING, BUT they were way too greasy. The grease leaked through the two tortillas and all over the pan and paper. Also, the green salsa was awful. When dining in, there were no chips and salsa given. What kind of Mexican restaurant doesn't do that? Employees also seemed unhappy. No type of customer service.

I really wanted to love La Pasadita. I live down the street and stopped in the for the first time last weekend. I was so disappointed. I'm from the south side and grew up in a largely hispanic neighborhood, so I have a specific love for Mexican food.  I ordered a bowl and a side of tortillas for a total of $11. It should have really been a $5 meal. Just very underwhelming in general.  I will be back because it is in the 'hood and will give the tacos a swing but so far... meh.

I had a $13 burrito that should have been a $5 burrito. I don't see what all the hype is. It wasn't particularly large or tasty even for a $5 burrito. Staff seemed hip. Felt love me they were trying to ride in the wave of seniority. First Chicago burrito something.

Upgrading my review for two reasons: their tacos and their horchata. Their tacos are packed with meat and a very good-sized, great tasting horchata for only $1.50 is hard to beat.  And they now take credit card!

I hate to do this as la pasadita on Ashland is a taco stand landmark here in chicago, but seriously what are they thinking charging $13 for a small size burrito!!!??  This happens when their head gets too big and know they have good tasting food and take advantage of the consumers pockets! How about staying humble with the pricing! Sad to say I'll be having second thoughts on returning. Won't be giving it one star since their meat is one of the best in chicago.
Ok, walking home :) the carne asada burritos  from La Pasadita are a thing of beauty. And do get two orders of the black sauce. So worth it!

This place used to be our favorite, like last meal before you die place. Not anymore. We bought tacos, burritos and chili rellenos for 5 people. Our total $93...whoa. Dug in and wtf these tacos suck. The meat wasn't tender and tasty as before. The tacos were so small they fit in less than the palm of my hand. The chili rellenos were flavorless, and pretty empty, they skimp on the cheese. We feel like a family member died. We have been coming here for over 30 years. We moved out of state but come back every year and la pasadita is our first stop BUT never again.

Was taken here by friends that recommended it. Turns out they were embarrassed at the end to have taken me there. I am Mexican and Mexican as hell. Disappointed with the service and food. The food was bland. Salsa was basically green water. No type of spice or even good taste. The guacamole was horrible as well. No flavor no salt no GUACAMOLE ingredients. I'm sure this place used to be great as my friends had said. Either get the old cooks back or figure something out...
Salsa was water down, horchata was water down and the young staff were very rude especially the girl taking the tacos to the table

First I'll start by saying this place needs an updated phone number on google maps. Also, there are no menus to take home or online. So obviously I ended up accidentally ordering from the wrong Pasadita. Also she got my order wrong. But they were fast and they are pretty tasty.

I went to Las Pasaditas restaurant because I had previously and mostly favorably read a few of the reviews and also due to it's location to Chopin Theatre and the supposed ease and free street parking on Sundays (I had to go around the block three times) until I found a parking spot near enough to Las Pasadita Restaurant and the Chopin Theatre. I lucked out there. As I walked across Ashland avenue to Las Pasaditas restaurant, I spied the 'hole in the wall' store front appearance. My past experiences with 'hole in the wall ' Mexican food establishments has been mostly favorable. I ordered the medium guacamole and side of chips  (note to self and to anyone reading my foodie review) their medium is equivalent to other restaurants side order +. However, it was delicious if not a bit on the $$ side for its tiny size. I also ordered 1 chili relleno taco and 1 carne asada taco. I asked for the tomato, lettuce, onion and cilantro. They forgot the cilantro (I did not complain as the cook was wielding a knife and appeared to know how to use it) therefore, i ate the tacos as presented. Actually, I devoured them due to being hungry, angry customers who looked mostly like street elements and freshly released or soon-to-be convicts. One woman was complaining in half English half Hispanic (while her BF withered in shame over her emotional demonstration) about how a true Mexican restaurant would never, no not ever be short on beans especially on a Sunday.  She changed her mind and took her and her BF' s order to go as she too was Theatre bound. Yes! I agreed between carnivorous bites that no beans to go with the rice was disappointing whether it was Sunday or not hence, my giving the restaurant -1 star less in my rating. Scanning my watch. I handed in my tray and thanked the cook for great food and fled to the Theatre with time to spare and safety in numbers as the show was sold out. Yes! I would definitely go back to Las Pasaditas  during daylight hours and hopefully, sample their rice AND beans.

First time, been driving past various locations for years! On the way to see a movie so we had to get in and out quickly. Sunday afternoon. The place was packed with all latino families, you know it's gonna be great when you see this. I had the Carne Asada Burrito with rice, beans, sour cream, onions, cilantro. It's the best burrito I've had in years. Plenty big enough, no need to order anything else. They call you number and bring you the food. Very friendly and helpful.

I was so excited about trying this place after reading the reviews. However, I am extremely disappointed. I ordered a chicken burrito that I paid almost $10 for. I ordered takeout and didn't get a chance to see what was in it until I got home. It turns out my burrito had literally nothing on it besides chicken and cilantro. If you go to any other Mexican restaurant, you will find that burrito has more than just chicken and cilantro. It turns out that I needed to order a so called "DELUXE" burrito to get all those extra ingredients that are typical of a burrito. And just an FYI, a DELUXE ranges around the $13 range. Ridiculous! Not going back there ever again. Rename the burrito you gave me to "DELUXE" taco so you won't deceive people.

From outside, this place might look like shit, but it is the best mexican taco you can have! Taste exactly as I had in Mexico! You can order anything there and you will love it. It is simple topping and delicious juicy meat inside!

Confession, this is a 2:45am taco post, so what if I've had a little to drink, I still know that the meat at La Pasadita is simply delicious. Barbacoa tostada, for $3.70 its loaded with melt in your mouth tender barbacoa, a lil Lettuce tomato and refried beans. So much tender delicious meat. Also got carne taco and chile relleno taco, the carne was cooked very well, I like that the relleno was packed with cheese but it's a lil heavy on the batter for me. The tortillas unfortunately leaves a little to be desired, but I'll be back for the barbacoa!
Went there a couple days ago and got 2 steak tacos and rice. Little did I know a few hours later I would end up with food poisoning. Never again

Two tiny soft tacos smaller than a McD's breakfast burrito, about a large tablespoon of guac, and an orange soda cost over $11 and took almost 15 minutes even though the place was 3/4 empty. Was going to order med guac for $4.50 but was $2 more for chips, so would have been like $16 for a meal that would cost that much including tax and tip at a decent Mexican restaurant with unlimited chips & salsa, actual service, and comfortable chairs instead of plastic immovable fast food seats that a gal with big boobs can't fit in without the food ending up on her clothes. The tacos were good but not stellar and I won't be back.

Let me be honest. I usually come here at 2 A.M. when I'm tipsy and giggly after a night out. With that said, THIS IS THE PLACE TO BE FOR LATE NIGHT TACOS! Try the steak tacos with cheese and cilantro, and you'll see what I mean. Honestly, two tacos hit the spot; they're pretty big! It's an easy walk in the summer after a night dancing at Beauty Bar. Lines get pretty long here, but that's a perfect opportunity for you to make new drunken friends.

Picked up 3 tacos (carne asada, lengua, barbacoa) for a quick late dinner to go. Food came out quick and flavor was decent, but the tortillas were a wet soggy mess - like to the point that they all fell apart and had to be eaten with a fork. I don't know if the tortillas were steamed too much or what, but definitely not what you want while eating a taco. Plenty of other places in the hood that do tacos right, probably won't bother to return.

The Carne Asada burrito here is the best in the business.  The meat is so tasty that I only add cilantro and onion as toppings.   Most of the items on the menu are also top notch, but the chicken is sometimes a bit dry.  The staff is polite and efficient. Only downside here is that it is a little pricey for simple Mexican food in a no frills environment.
Their corn tortillas are divine. The chili rellano taco is sublime. El pastor taco, is average.
I have been coming here since high school and the tacos are by far consistent. It is a place where you order your tacos and eat them  elsewhere as the restaurant is not up-to-date.
Best burrito and prices in chicago. Hands down. My review doesn't need to be any longer. It's all right there.

I am allergic to gluten and dairy. I made that clear to the cashier and she looked puzzled like she never heard of an allergy. Needless to say, she was a rude Latina w a heart tattoo on her hand. She also made my food wrong 3 times and on top of that the cook didn't wash his hands and made my food w his hands and I got sick from cross contamination. Trust me, Mexican food is about the safest thing I can eat and they messed it up by being dirty. Stay away from here, if they can't wash their hands to make food then they prob don't wash their hands after the bathroom. And the cashier, after I kept letting her know what I'm allergic to and what to take out of the food-nothing but attitude. I'm so embarrassed that I even picked this place out and took my family here. Never again.

When God first created the heavens and the earth, he took a break to have lunch many, many times. During those lunches, he also created tacos.  Pasadita must've gotten his recipe. These tacos are absolutely delicious. I stuck with my usual chicken tacos and simply added onion and cilantro on them but got guac on the side. The simplicity didn't take away from anything! They also have burritos and tortas and a couple of other Mexican items, but the menu isn't convoluted at all.  Wait time isn't that bad and prices are very reasonable!

Moving to Chicago from East LA was tough.  When I was feeling homesick, I'd come here and get two or three barbacoa tacos.  A side of rice and beans and a jarritos and you're set.  My favorite tacos barbacoas

Obsessed. I eat here on a weekly basis and have yet to be disappointed. My most recent time I decided to try the "Chachos". Their version of nachos. They were incredible. The meat (carne Assad) was so flavorful and cooked wonderfully. You can also get chicken, or both. Then it's topped with beans, guac, sour cream, and cheese. Add lettuce and tomato for no charge. There was so much!! Def shareable and highly recommended. The Chachos are $9! Also ALWAYS get the horchata. So cheap and so yum.

Paid $7.50 for a veggie burrito with zero flavor. It had no fresh ingredients and way too much sour cream. They charge $.25 for a cup of water too. What's up with that? It's like they're punishing you for not buying soda. It came to $9.00 with my water and tax. Not the friendliest service either.  The only way they're staying in business is either because it's the only place that's close by or it's because people don't know what real Mexican food is supposed to taste like. Do yourself a favor and go someplace else.

You know, I think I've been to La Pasadita before, but I must have somehow missed reviewing it. The other thing is, a good friend of mine turned me on to the chile relleno burrito as an amazing option. As a vegetarian, I've usually stuck with a simple veggie burrito. But anway, the chile relleno burrito was great. One thing we talked about afterwards is that it's even better when you put in the beans, lettuce, tomatoes, etc. The one I had only had the relleno, onions, and cilantro. So I look forward to having all the fixin's next time. I also had a quick taste of the tostada. It was pretty good as well, but the burrito I had was way way better. :-)

I suppose if this was the only establishment open within a 3 mile radius and I was starving, then perhaps I'd return. The staff was super nice, but the tacos were not. I had 2 carne asada tacos, and I ate at the restaurant. The meat was tough and lacked flavor/seasoning. You can almost certainly find better elsewhere.

I asked twice what ingredients are on the veggie burrito, and after hearing the ingredients, I asked for no sour cream. I got home to find a lot of fresh cilantro  (never mentioned and I detest it) and sour cream. It also clearly was never very warm as there was no sign of the cheese being even remotely melted. I won't be returning.

My coworker used to tell me back in the day this was his staple for tacos or burritos, I feel like those days have passed. Came here after work, for some tacos. Got a carne asada, al pastor, and lengua taco. The first two were ok, the lengua omg. I have had lengua tacos or beef tongue tacos before, and they are not as disgusting as it sounds but here they are. Usually they are seasoned, and cooked so that you dont know you are eating tongue, here you deff know you are eating tongue. Its slimey, gooey, had to force it down. Which might have been a bad idea, because I had a pretty bad stomachache the next night. Call it what it is, some say this spot is legendary, authentic, but the truth is today there a many late night taco joints, and so many in this area especially, I'll pass.
you get what you pay for. coming here since 89. now I work next door and love it. nothing beats the smell of the steak surrounding the block.
Typical Mexican fare. Bummed they didn't have French fries . Good for late night post party fare. The black salsa is amaze balls. Open late which is perfect.
They have noticeably picked up their speed of getting food out. Big plus for us since we can now go back to being regulars. Yay. :)

Wow!  What happened to this place after they downsized?  The burritos are 40% smaller and the small steak burrito is $10!  I went in there tonight after work and they don't have menu's now, and you pay BEFORE you sit.  Huh?  It wasn't that way before the downsize.  Tonight the female cashier asked me what I wanted and I said, "Steak burrito, no onions or tomatoes, and I do want cilantro".  She said she didn't know what I wanted because, "It only comes with onions and cilantro" and again asked me what I wanted  I repeated my order and she kept repeating that "it comes with onions and cilantro".  She seriously couldn't understand that all she had to do was hold the onions and we were on the same page.  Other customers were laughing as I tried to keep from laughing myself because I didn't want the poor girl to feel bad.  I still can't understand why she kept telling me that the burrito, "... doesn't COME with tomatoes, sir!!!" when I told her I didn't want any.  Why not just say, "Great, it doesn't come with them... I'll hold the onions and we're all set!".  I ate my tiny $10 burrito, never to return again.  I've been going there for 9 years now, but I can get larger burritos with less hassle closer to my condo.

Well I would've given this two stars for the flavorless steak tacos with chewy meat and the fact that they nickel and dime you for everything (really? 25 cents for a styrofoam cup of water?) but now lowering to one star (zero if I could) a day and a half later for giving me FOOD POISONING. DO NOT GO HERE!!!!
My new favorite taco place ! Wow - steak tacos were out of this world amazing !! Service friendly and the tacos were stuffed with meat !!!
THEY ARE NOT KIDDING ABOUT THE STEAK!!! Sooo tender, juicy and flavorful. Not filled with a bunch of extras, which i normally love, but i surprisingly enjoyed without that.

I love this place. The interior is not fancy, not is the exterior for that matter BUT..these tacos are probably the best steak tacos i've ever had. omg. One week I think I went three days straight.lol I love it.

The super burrito used to be huge! Over the past year the burrito keeps getting smaller and smaller. Today I went in the location on Irving Park and there was barely any meat in the burrito. I wanted to let you know you did not fool the customer. It is better to raise your price then to lower your quality.

$3 for a Carne Asada taco. It was extremely salty and felt as though I was chewing leather.  If your prices are that high for mediocre food I would at least home the restaurant would be clean. It was a dump.

What can we say about La Pasasdita other than the fact that they have the best steak tacos like.... Ever!!! This is the first Mexican restaurant I've ever been to where I ordered steak tacos 3 days in a row from the first day I tried them.  Their chicken is very good also. The parrillada Estillo Pasadita is a great deal also because it easily feeds a family of 4 and it's a mixture of everything delicioso! The customer service is the greatest but it's not the most important thing I'm looking for in a Mexican restaurant. I just want great quality food at a fair price.
All the way from Cali just to have the mouth-watering carne asada tacos.  Highly recommended.

I have been coming here for years now and I love their tacos and burritos. They are always busy and open really late. Their prices have gone up quite a bit over the years but the taste is still really good.

I've been coming here for years and the food never disappoints. Only complaint I have is the seemingly increasing cost to dine here;, I understand the area they're located in is upscale, but they should really consider offering something new like taco Tuesday specials to remain competitive. Getting too expensive but hey, gentrification...
I remember when this place was my go to place until they got cheap with the salsas who charges for the black salsa. Good thing there's las asadas where they don't charge for the black salsa

Since I left my feedback on their Facebook page and they probably deleted, I'll be happy to leave mine here, hopefully this will reach out to more customers. My family and I have been customers since 30 years ago, and traveled over 40 miles to come to la pasadita, back then the owner was a pleasure to deal with, he was always making sure he's customers were happy, great kind and caring men. Unfortunately now his daughter who has no idea of how to run a business and has a nasty attitude and is arrogant to customers, I'm sure I'm not the only one who will stop giving our business to this taco place. It's unfortunate that the founder it's no longer here RIP. I have seen through the years how from 3 locations there's just one left. It's very sad that this lady's rude, arrogant and smart mouth will end up sending this business to failure. Clearly she didn't learn the good ways of her father, the founder of la pasadita. Stop being so arrogant, cocky and rude, perhaps you can use some of your profit and get some education but remember class can't be bought. I'll make sure all my friends and family will support me and will never bring our business to this place ever again!!!

The perfect late night food after an impromptu bar crawl of my own making. Most people opt for the sit down restaurant next door, but for a bit of the old in-out, in-out, stop into the express location off Ashland. The service is quicker albeit at the expense of a smaller menu; strictly tacos and burritos and sans rice and beans. The meats are as follows: carne asada, pollo, barbacoa, and lengua (tongue). Though the experience will be rendered invalid should you order anything besides the carne asada tacos with cilantro and cebolla. Paz was clutching the cash register to stay upright and almost ordered 3 lengua tacos before I stopped her and corrected the order for her. We were in desperate need of grease and meat after making a night of hopping bar to bar. She only agreed to go to the first one after some minor groveling on my part, assuring her we were meeting up with The Bae, except when she wasn't at Schubas I said she was actually at Flat Iron, and then Bangers & Lace, and then EvilOlive, the whole time I'm buying us round after round, her refusing and then gulping the cosmo as I tip it to her lips. La Pasadita's carne asada maintains a char grilled flavor after the skirt steak exterior has reached an acceptable crust, then chopped and cooked further, which separates the meat into pulled strips normally seen through slow cooking methods, and what doesn't immediately go into a tortilla to be served is placed in a warming bin, where the carne is allowed to soak in its own juices, a bonus for anyone ordering the carne asada burrito as it catches the liquid, reabsorbing it into the meat. It's tempting but I go with four tacos instead, making sure to ask for one tortilla on each instead of two. The carne's so tender and juicy that this means the tortilla will grow soggy and fall apart if I'm not careful, but I don't mind a little messiness (nudge, nudge. Eww). Either way Paz doesn't get the joke, who's sitting in a booth but still managing to sway, her eyes half open, the overhead lights catching in the saliva that rolls off her bottom lip, glimmering. I have to literally unwrap the taco for her and put it in her hand ("Put something," she mumbles, taco in hand, "in my drink," before I legit push the taco in her mouth.) For drink options, I advise you to skip the Mexican Coke (a recent article proved there is no real difference between Mexican Coke and our domestic version. It's all in your head) and order the large horchata (rice water), a cinnamony concoction that's yummy and is served in a Styrofoam cup big enough for two, except Paz passes out so I have no finish it on my own (Le sigh). Fireman carry it is.

We arrived at 2:50 AM expecting some amazing tacos. Instead the door and gate were slammed shut prematurely and a woman was yelling "estamos cerrados." . We are regulars here, and to be treated like this is awful. I guess we will go to Pilsen for tacos and pizza for late night.

The food is worth 5 stars and normally, the service would be too. But today, the service was a 1 star. I found today's cashier to be very rude even to the point of shoving my order at me. I will go again and hopefully it won't be the same cashier. If I do encounter her again with the same result, I will not patronize their business.
Prices have become a bit high for Mexican, but still the best in town and I am coming back.
By far the best taco ever! Not only in Chicago but all over the USA. The reason why I say that is because I travel a lot (every week) and I never ate taco better than La Pasadita.

If you are looking for Tacos, this is the place to go! I've been to many taco places in Chicago and outside Chicago and never found anything like this place. I am not sure about the other stuff on their menu thou. Try the carne assada tacos, they are awesome!

Hate to say it but this place lost its soul. It use to be four things done really really well. Since a bunch of nightclubbing idiots came into the neighborhood they have stopped making Mexican food that is authentic and well done street food and now caters to drunk, white 20 somethings. It started with chicken on the menu and went down hill from there. It's a small 3 man at best line and with every new item the quality of the tried and trues has suffered. My ultimate dream is that they say "fuck this shit" and go back to concentrating on the original four items they did really well. Until then I mourn La Passadita like a long gone friend.

Awesome Carne Asada & Lengua here, tacos or burritos!  But you might as well get a burrito if you're planning to get a few tacos ($2.50 - $3.00ea).  Their burritos are pretty huge from $8.50 - $10. A lot of dining space and they have a parking lot  as well.
The food here is awesome. Great vegetarian options too!! The salsa verde is so spicy and SOO GOOD.
Hands down the best tacos in the city! Try the carne asada tacos or super burrito!

I paid $12 for a burrito from a hole in the wall taco joint and I wasn't even hungover. Granted, they call it the "super burrito" but the only thing super about it is the price. It would be justified if it came with gold sprinkles, chips, guac, and a never ending fountain drink. But it doesn't.  Don't get me wrong, it was a solid burrito. But I also had a solid burrito at Turbo Tacos a few days ago for $6. So there's that. You know what else I can get for $12? 26 burritos from Taco Bell.
Alright the burrito is good..but who do you think you are charging $12.50+ tax? Size to dollar ratio just really isn't making sense here. Three stars 4 u.

Sadly... I have come to this place for over 15 years. I have seen the metamorphosis along the years. The customer service has improved but the quality of the food is getting a bit ridiculous. The tacos are very small now. In addition, the carne asada is HALF fat. I basically discard 50% of the meat because it's all chewy, fatty and disgusting.  They also give you green sauce for free but they charge .50 cents for "salsa negra". Seriously? I can probably make a gallon of salsa negra for 2 dollars.  The tortillas used to be just steamed/warmed but they now added grease?. What's the deal with that ? I keep coming back in hopes one day they go back to the quality from the past. They are not the best tacos in Chicago at all and BTW they are expensive for what it is.  One of the pros is that they open until very late so once you're out and about you hit this place to get a bite.
Amazing tacos! I can honestly say, these are the best tacos in Chicago!
I've eaten here twice now. The first time, my burrito was cold. I gave it a 2nd shot and it was actually warm. A bit expensive for what you get--and chips and salsa are 2 separate charges..?!

Used to come here when I lived in the neighborhood 7 years ago for classic cilantro and onion tacos. Glad to report just as good if not better super meaty carne asada tacos. These were loaded with meat. Salsa verde to accompany was really good too. Don't let the price deter you, these are worth it.
Best and most authentic tacos I have had since living in Mexico City. Seriously could have died and gone to heaven while eating the carne asada. Serious highlight of my entire trip to Chicago.

Rated one of the best burritos in Chicago, and i would agree, but since that happened and this place is getting a little trendy and more popular the prices have been raised, i think its a little high for this kind of food, so i dont go as much but when i have a taste for a really good burrito or tacos, or even the chille relenos this is the place to come.
The carne asada and barbacoa tacos are great and way cheep.   Have yet to try much else on the menu but I would recommend based on what I've had.

came here for the steak burrito and steak nachos that I see on their yelp page.. after arrival.. I was looking at their menu and I don't see nachos anywhere.. then I asked them and they said they don't serve nachos.. the nachos was my main reason to come here too.. but I don't blame them.. maybe yelp members posted it to the wrong restaurant or they just don't make them anymore.. so I just ordered a steak burrito and it comes with steak, cilantro and onions... portion is a pretty decent size and with loaded with a lot of meat.. but.. the meat tasted pretty bland and just covered with a lot of salt.. don't know will I come back to give it another try

Came here for the awesome Burritos but just saw one of their Kitchen staff walk out of the bathroom laboring in there for 10 min with no sound of the sink being used. When I walked into the bathroom, the sink was also bone dry. 1st and last time here for me.
The food isn't bad at all, but it is extremely overpriced and the portions are small. There are much better options in the area.

Love the food, but they need to change the $ to $$$ . Wow!!!!  have they gone up in price! I think they raised the prices 3 times in the past year. The place is a dive. For all that money they charge , you shouldn't have to wait in a line ,or sit in cheap bench seats . Don't even bother to call ahead for your food either.  They will tell you 5-10 come pick it up. .but it won't be ready til after you wait there 15 minutes.  So , I think I will be finding another place to go. $34 for 2 burritos( not the super ones either) and 2 pepper tacos  is just too much money.

The carne asada tacos were great! The meat was cooked perfectly. The chile relleno taco was OK. I've had better. The prices are decent but sides seemed overpriced. This is not a fancy place so if thats what you're looking for STAY AWAY. If you're looking for some good tacos at a decent price, check this place out!

Pretty good taco de asada, it really is BUT the portions were small, especially for the price. It is shocking because many mexicans like to eat a nice MEATY taco and this place should know NOT TO SKIMP BUT like many other mexican taco spots in Chicago, that know how to make a well salted skirt steak taco, they price high but pack low. This trend in Chicago needs to end or new comers need to come and set a better standard. Places love to get customers but hate to pack tacos. No one with an appetite should have to pay almost $3.00 a taco and not fulfill their hunger. This is where the good supermarket tacos win and could soon trend above many "backsliding" taco joints.   Keep in mind,  it is really not hard to buy a pack of arranchera (skirt steak) for under $10, salt, and give a quick sear, and chop. With that in mind,  taco joints should really try to regard that some people do buy tacos to avoid the work but not because they are ignorant of how to make a similar taco... Therfore,  give a proper taco, not a children's size taco.  Now,  as for the lengua tacos they were fair in portions but needed a bit more chopping (slightly more). Overall, the steak and lengua meat had a great salted & charred taste, the salsa was good, the place could use upgrades, and the portions should reflect the price. Hope they make a change because they've been around for a while but many new comers are eager to step into the arena and set a new standard... Which will put many out of business if they open nearby.
First place we came to eat in chicago and we loved it! Great service and amazing tacos! Will definitely recommend to everyone from Miami! Best part is, they're open late!

This place is alright. I've been here a few times, always after leaving a bar near by. It's one of the rare restaurants still open at 3 am, so therefore it's usually packed, so prepare to wait. I usually get the steak burrito but switched it up this time because of lent. When I get up to order, there's a sign that says no chicken, no chips, no horchata.... Like I said, it was alright. Don't get why it's more expensive than the meat options though. Yea it takes more prep probably but it's just cheese inside a pepper. So yea, stick to the meat options, more bang for your buck.

This is the best Taco place ever. Have been coming here since I was little and bringing people here and getting them hooked on these tacos. Don't know what they do with their steak but it's the best I have ever and many tasted. :)

La pasadita is good but not great. The tacos are relatively small and for $3 it's not really worth it. I've had better for less. This place had a reputation for having large delicious tacos. Not anymore. They're small and expensive, I'll have to cross the street and try AuthenTaco next time. I paid $22 for 3 tacos, 1 burrito and a coke. That's pricey.
Chile relleno tacos are the best!  Carne Asada has no comparison...  Very few places can do what these guys can!

In short customers future customers beware horrible experience deplorable eating conditions and the worst service I have ever experienced in any establishment in any country its sad that I had to experience this in my own home town it's sad that some businesses take advantage of the fact that they have a captive audience by opening their doors in the wee hours of the night but eventually the Sun comes up and reviews get placed on social media and other buyers become aware of the atrocious situation that occurs in this establishment if you're hungry pack a lunch bite your nails just do not go in there

I love the carne asada tacos. The meat tasted great. I love that they put cilantro in the tacos. So good. Hot sauce is good too. Only problem is that it's not cheap, but well worth the price if you have the money in my opinion. They keep it simple. Would recommend if you are around the area.

Ok.This is where i just felt like writing a review for a throwback restaurant i visited in the past.That means the food was classic.Thanks to Cheno(Edgar P) for introducing me to this legendary mexican cuisine.One of the Best Chicken tacos ive tasted ever.I cant speal for them all but this is where ive been on few drunk nights and i really mean HIT THE SPOT DELICIOUS.Burritos whatever.Just order and you'll see.Trust me..

Best Big Burrito in Chicago North Side  It's been 25 years to stop by when ever I get a chance

One of my favorite taco joints! If you like your tacos with a lot of meat I promise you- you will not be disappointed here! I love their tortas, tacos, and burritos! I guess its a bit overpriced but when you see how big they are you change your mind- its really good!

This is definitely a good place to get some really good Carne asada tacos and Barbacoa tacos even when make it American taco-adding the sour cream, lettuce and tomato, which isnt extra charge if im not mistaken. Unfortunately they dont give free chips when you dine in. Order was quick and service was ok...i also tried the Pollo-chicken taco and Chile Relleno but i dont like them as much...Price was ok for portion but i think the tacos would be better if they used flour instead of corn taco

If you're looking for a straightforward and classic taco this is the place to go. They're my favorite carne asada tacos in the area. I wish I could give them five stars, but the prices are a bit steep.

I freaking love this place. I've been coming here for like five years come city always think this is the best burrito. Cilantro steak onion what's not to love for o'clock in the night or 2 o'clock in afternoon or for what spices awesome this place is awesome

EXCELLENT STEAK TACOS!!!!!!! As a child I hated when my mom would come here. I said the tacos tasted funny. As an adult I've grown to realize that the funny taste is A GREAT GRADE OF STEAK!!!! These other places I thought I loved are selling dog shit for tacos!!!!! Seriously, everyone I introduce to this place loves it.  They have dine in and carry out. I always eat in the car while they're still hot. I always order the steak tacos. Maybe one day I'll try the chicken tacos and a burrito.  Food is always cooked to order in front of you. This is my boyfriend's fav taco joint, hands down. When he first took me, we entered through an alley so I was hesitant. At first, it was eh to me, but it grew on me. They specialize in serving pretty much just plain ole' tacos and a few other Mexican staples. I personally prefer El Milagro which my BF and I fight over all the time! I have been getting burritos from here forever. I NEVER order burritos so that let's you know how good they are.  They do it right. Steak, onion and cilantro with salsa on the side. La Pasadita is Spanish for "nexus of the universe," since this corner of Ashland and Division has so many Pasaditas it would make Lewis Black's head spin. I think I'm reviewing the right one, which is the one just north of the other one. La Pasadita is German for "chewy meat product," which is a minus in an otherwise tasty carne asada burrito. Its beef is well-marinated and tasty, but get a tough chargrilled piece, and you'll be gnawing on that bad boy for ages. La Pasadita is Chinese for "meat stuffing," because its burritos come with enough meat to stuff a socking and not much else. There's cilantro and onion, with a spicy salsa verde on the side. That makes it a burrito in the sense that it uses a large tortilla, but you could call it an oversized taco and that would be more appropriate. La Pasadita is French for "mucho dinero," which is what it costs to make this a burrito proper. You can add guacamole, sour cream, cheese, and tomatoes, but that'll cost you an extra $2.50 for a sparse spoonful of the good stuff, on top of an already expensive burrito. This location also serves rice and beans on the side, but I don't think you can add it directly to the burrito to make it a "super burrito." According the the cashier, that can be done at the La Pasadita directly south of this La Pasadita. La Pasadita is English for "pretty good," which is what their burrito is. If anything, it makes me seriously question Nate Silver's food choices (in the 538 burrito bracket, he proclaimed it the greatest burrito of all-times).

My boss and I wanted to eat lunch at La Pasadita after our business meeting in the area today.  When we first started venturing into this area a few years ago, there were 3 La Pasadita locations on Ashland just south of Division.  Currently there is only one that is open (the one on the east side of Ashland is a different place now, and the "south" one we usually go to is currently under rehab), so we took our chances and ate here at the "north" location.  This La Pasadita is a bit more divey, as you order at the register first and then the server will bring the food to your table.  There is a decent amount of seating, and there was a portable heater situated at one location because it was not that warm in the dining area.  There are some murals on the walls for ambiance, with some old video games stashed in the back.  We noticed that one game's old-school graphics were rather violent in nature, so perhaps this is not exactly the taco joint to go on a date night.    The menu is also more limited than the other La Pasadita, so I ordered a chile relleno taco and two barbacoa tacos.  The tacos were tightly wrapped so they initially looked small in the basket, but there was plenty of filling in each of the tasty tacos.  Both kinds of tacos were generously topped with chopped onion and cilantro (we heard chopping sounds in the back, and imagined an unfortunate employee chopping onions until he or she spouted tears).  My boss ordered a carne asada burrito and also a side of rice and beans.  He said the burrito was juicy but not as good as the food at the other La Pasadita.

The chile relleno taco is pretty awesome as well and about the best bet on the menu if you're vegetarian or just want the most food for your money.  Free chips and salsa while you wait is definitely a plus and they let you BYOB if for some odd reason you're hear before the bars let out. Overall it's a pretty solid taco shop.

Definite hole in the wall, but it beats the hell out of Chipotle, as long as your do not need to be impressed by the atmosphere.  Authentic, cheap, delicious burritos. Options are a bit limited and the only toppings you can get are onions and cilantro, but tasty regardless.  We got one steak burrito and one barbacoa burrito - definitely recommend the steak; better overall flavor.

The chile releno burrito I got seriously did not cut it. My friend's came loaded with sour cream, and mine had onions that were wilted and way too spicy. The green pepper was cakey on the outside and oozing with cheese as if it was a store-bought jalapeno popper-not to mention, the fried thing seemed coated in corndog batter. UGH.
Nice place! An authentic Taco joint in the trendy Ukranian Village. Very simple selection but vegetarian options are available! I asked for egg in my burrito and they were very accommodating. Yum!
This place is good. It's a no frills taqueria. Price is hard to beat, portions are definitely heavy. There was probably an entire cow's tongue in the lengua burrito.
I cannot eat at this place after seeing how utterly filthy it is inside. I have no idea how they pass their health inspection. They pulled out their chopped cilantro in an actual grocery bag. Nasty.

I had the best burrito  and horchata of my life here! Sooo tasty! I don't have a whole lot to add except it get's busy, they take their time in preparing your food and there is a seating area. The menu isn't extensive and there is very little parking but it is worth checking out.

I'm currently here I placed my order to go at 725 it's now 745 and all I ordered was 2 tacos and a guac and chips this is absolutely ridiculous and to top it off they ran out of chorizo and tampiquena one of their dishes who knows what else they ran out of and to top it off they keep putting the meat in the microwave before they're putting it on the grill and the waitress just dropped a cover to the hot sauce bottle on the floor and just placed it back on the bottle like nothing happened a customer had to point it out to her and all she had to say was oh. I've never written a review before for a restaurant so for me to do this should tell you something about this place. Be cautious.

There are La Pasaditas are over.  The one to go at is the one with the yellow sign.  It's delightfully "hole in the wall".  It's a delicious minimalist menu.  Tacos and burritos.  Their skirt steak is top notch.  Absolutely my favorite local restaurant to frequent.

this is the best taco I've ever had.... at two in the morning on the way home in a cab.    ok, now that I've qualified my review somewhat, I'll say I would have given them a five if they woulda remembered my extra green sauce.   5 tacos and two sauces just doesn't cut it.   Good thing they sell coke and not pepsi, I would have knocked it down to a 2.

Let me commence this review by saying that the ingredients in my burrito were top notch. Other than that, this place was total bullshit.  Ordered a carne asada burrito earlier today, $8. Sounds reasonable. An extra $1 for guacamole. Again, totally reasonable. Would I like cilantro and onion on that? Asked the young gentleman at the counter. Yes I would. As my wife ordered her pollo asada burrito and had to pay extra for cheese, something that's rarely an extra charge in burrito experience, I noticed on the menu board most things that come standard in a burrito cost extra here. While processing this, my wife asked for a cup for water. No water. Not even bottles to purchase. Really? That's fucking weird, but okay. We sit down, and realize we didn't get chips, so I go back up and ask. No dice, there are no chips. What the fuck? Isn't this a taqueria? Now that's super weird, but whatever, we're hopeful. The burritos come, and what the fuck? Where's the rice, beans, and fucking pico de gallo salsa? We're fairly new to Chicago, and I don't really now how you guys do here, but back in California $8 gets you a minimum of rice, beans, cheese, salsa, onions, cilantro and choice of meat. Chips and salsa are $2 more at the most, and guacamole and sour cream will run you an extra $.50-$1.50 depending on that restaurant. Now I've had plenty of great tacos so far here in Chicago, but I don't know if I can handle your standard of burrito if this is what I have to look forward to. Winter and the humidity are already hard enough.

Nothing beats the simplicity and flavor of a steak burrito from La Pasadita, with just onion and cilantro. You could get a bunch of toppings for $1.50 more, but it just dilutes the taste of the amazing carne asada.

Visited again not too long after first time. These are one of those places where you don't care so much about the prices, because of how good it is.  Ordered the same thing from last time, to-go; only the lady at the counter told me I am not able to have 1 of the tacos as lengua because it's a higher price point? I said, 'that's fine, I'll pay extra no matter how much.' She angrily insisted it's not possible... Then how the hell was I able to order what I ordered the other day? Loca.
After many years, still my favorite late night mexican taco place. The steak is just too good to pass up. Forget taco burrito king, this place puts meat in there steak!
Carne Asada Burrito's! I could eat these everyday. So simple and so good.

This place used to be good.  Now they're desperate to stay in business.  I ordered the regular steak to go and waited.  While I was waiting, two customers had carry out orders that were incomplete and missing items that they had paid for.  A third fellow came in and complained that his order was incomplete and not what he ordered.  Naturally, the woman at the register asked to see his receipt.  She hadn't given me a receipt either, so I wasn't surprised to hear him say that he didn't get one.    My surprise was waiting for me when I got home and found that I didn't get what I had ordered.    That was my last visit to this dump.  The city of Chicago health inspectors will be closing this place down soon.  Get your e-coli while you can!!

I tried this place for the first time today and they had NO limes, jalapeños, avocados, cilantro, or red salsa.  How can this place be a Mexican restaurant when they are missing all of the Mexican essentials?? And the worst part was that the only salsa they had was so watered down that it tasted like water with a spicy after taste. When I complained to the waitress she said "that's just how the salsa was made today." Wow! They didn't even have Tapatio or Valentina to add some flavor to the gross food. I will never go back!

This is definitely a place you should only frequent if you are drunk off your culo! It use to be a really great place that was always packed. I would come here every weekend when I got off work with my coworkers and family members. The place has never been nice, but I think it made the experience. Then it got horrible! Shitty ass food, horrid service and then the lack of decor started to bother me. I hadn't been there in two years till last night. I think they are slowly getting back in the game, but its too late now. A taco place is opening up across the street from them and they will probably blow them out of the water. Instead of opening up locations all over the city, they should improve the ones they already have. Getting to the top is easy, staying there is a whole other story. Your tacos are great again! Get some damn paint cans at least and fix the place up!

This place isn't worth coming in to, but to perhaps fulfill a small bite after a good night of partying in the Wicker Park neighborhood.  Definitely not for a regular Lunch/Dinner plate.  I remember coming here with my father as a child through-out the years and such; everything was great:  amount of meat on my tacos(now mediocre), customer service and bathroom(which are disgusting). La Pasadita failed on all these, and it's truly a shame.  Allow me to begin on the authenticity, which is there, however not at all worth $2.50 for steak taco and $3.00 for a lengua taco, and $4.50 on small tortas.  NOT AT ALL WORTH IT that price, when they add such mediocre amount of meat, cheese and beans to my tortas! The meat on the tacos is as well pinched.   Their prices have risen in the past years, which I guess is what they think is reasonable, due to their location and the demographics that keep changing.  However, if you're going to raise your prices still offer me the same amount of meat to my tacos and tortas! Frustration doesn't end just there.  Their customer service makes it worse.  I had to remind our waitress 2 times, for both my limes and horchata (rice water); I guess flirting for over 5 minutes, with a man that was about to pay was more of a priority.  And of course, after she was done smiling and giggling she managed to forget my limes and horchata.  Come on lady, get it together.  Just when I knew I wasn't going to eat lunch here anymore; a quick trip to the bathroom finalized me ever wanting to come back.  Their ladies bathroom was filthy.  There was toilet paper all over the floor and no bathroom soap.  A restaurant, in fact any business should ALWAYS be aware of their bathrooms.  Bathrooms tell a lot about a business and this just topped it off.   I won't be coming here any longer.  Nothing is impressing, their carna asada is grilled ok, fine, but that's all.   They keep raising their prices and yet still believe reducing the amount of content is OK, as if there bolillo(Mexican torta bread) wasn't small enough! PS-If what you're looking for good authentic Mexican food, you don't have to trouble far, "La Traspasada", is on Ashland and Chicago.  Here they serve real tacos, burritos and tortas packed with meat!  It's small but they don't lack flavor, authenticity, and amount.   I myself will only go here from now on.

Solid tacos, but a bit overpriced- .50 extra per taco for SC? .50 extra per taco for cheese? Come on now I can go spend the same amount at Antique Taco ...19.50 for four tacos? I will just go to Antique Taco down the street.

This place is pretty cool. I love that they are open late. I love that you can bring booze in here and drink it. B.Y.O.B. and the steak in the steak tacos and burritos has that really tasty char grilled flavour! Once in a while, I have gotten a meal here that was only sort of so-so. All in all, pretty killer late night Mexican grub!
Best steak burrito I've ever had.  The meat is marinaded to perfection.

Both my wife and I are not getting the rave reviews of this place.  I can get better tacos up in Madison, Wisconsin.  The carne asada is OK as you would expect.  The tongue is really moist and tender, but as with all the tacos there is nothing else but the meat.  If that is your thing, great, but I need some seasoning or something to really bring the taco together.  The barbacoa is also very well cooked, but again just steamed meat.  Finally I was intrigued by the chile relleno taco and while the pepper is good the breading is too thick, almost like a corn dog.  We ended up peeling most of it off. I think this place is hyped merely because every other Mexican place of note is nowhere near the center of the city.

Yelp led us astray. We found this place very average. Out female server didn't really care, while a young guy working there was super pleasant and checked on us and had a chat. Our food was bland. We had to use quite a bit of hot sauce, and even the hot sauce was bland. And my partners taco was so wet he picked it up and it fell in a sloppy mess into the basket. He ate a bit was a fork, but wasn't keen, so left most behind.  The best thing though is the price and the serving size. It's all pretty good value.

Love, love LOVE this place! I live in what may be the taco capital of North America (Fruitvale Ave, Oakland, California) and these are still the best tacos I've ever had. And the chile relleno taco?! I've never even seen such a thing! I could eat them forever....

Finally! A real Mexican joint in the Windy City!!! Took us 1/2 hour (2 trains) to get here and it was definitely worth it. After the first few bites, my husband literally said it would be worth the trip even in the snow. We both had the steak burritos and my husband had a beef taco. The quality of the steak is what you would expect for real Mexican food. Basic burrito, meat + onions + cilantro. Amazing. And we've spent some big bucks in this town trying to find Mexican food that could quench our Southern California appetites. The only thing missing was red sauce / hot sauce. They have the green sauce but it just doesn't cut it. Not hot enough.  We ordered an extra 2 steak burritos for home later that night.  TIPS: not a lot of selection on beverages (a new canned and bottles). Best just to top at the CVS around the corner afterwards for that second beverage than paying $2 for a can.  Environment: not much to look at. Bare bones but what else do you need at this point?
Food was terrible. Steak wasn't even cooked all the way. After tase wad like a dirty dish rag. Disgusting!!!!!

Made the mistake of telling the cashier that we would eat inside of the restaurant. We waited 20 minutes to be handed a bowl of chips and the server walked away. 20 minutes later, she came to take our order. I'm like can we get salsa with these chips. She's like ooh yea I will go get it. 10 minutes later, she returned to take our order. Finally, our order was placed and we were eating about 20 minutes later.  Granted it was a full house but dang, they have been in business long enough to know people are hungry on a Saturday late night.  Ne who Food is GREAT. Always have been, is the only reason I come back here. Almost makes you forget about how slow they are!
This is place is past its prime.  The tacos are not very good and the hot sauce is poor.   There are dozens of these places so time to move on.

I love La Pasadita (original 3 locations). I grew up on it. Due to the gentrification of the neighborhood though its constantly gotten expensive over the years. Ate some tacos with my friend and the bill was over $20. Really? For two people? Ridiculous. I could name 5 taquerias that match the taste but are way cheaper.  I won't say I won't go back but, I sure wouldn't make the effort to visit La Pasadita. #Disappointedlifelongfan
There are no words to describe how amazing the Mexican food is here. I love their Horchata, I love their tacos, I love everything! Highly recommend!!! Very inexpensive!
Awful food. Horrible service. No idea how this ever got a good Yelp review. Honestly the worst taco I've ever had.

We ordered the carne asada taco and burrito, and the meat on both was nearly inedible. It was SO tough and chewy that I didn't finish my taco because my jaw was tired. Furthermore, the burrito was nothing more than a giant taco: meat, onions, and cilantro on a tortilla. No rice, beans, cheese, etc... The Barbacoa taco was a better texture than the carne asada, but it lacked flavor. The chile relleno tacos were the best thing we ordered, but I wouldn't go back for those alone. Also, they were all out of guacamole. Really? A Mexican restaurant with no guac? So I walked two doors down to their sister restaurant (same name) to get a side of guac. It was totally tasteless.  I've had better luck at Picante just a few blocks away on Division.
I think I got the right restaurant. There's so many. Anyways, their ribeye and chicken tacos are top notch. It's my favorite taco in Chicago so far.

Really really disappointed this time. Not the same place it was last year. They closed the one on the East side of the street, but the flavors did not make the jump to the West side as seamlessly as I would have hoped.

I ordered the veggie burrito (which was nothing special) and my friend ordered some tacos which were nasty. First they got the taco order wrong which we didn't notice till we opened our food at home. My friend ordered meat tacos (forget which kind) with onions and no cilantro but received two tacos packed with cilantro absent onions. Sigh. We cut up our own onions and added it to the tacos...then decided to throw on some cheese since the tacos were seriously lacking on their own. I also didn't like the venue, hence we took our meals to go. I know you can't expect very much at chained locations such as these but that's no excuse for the dankness I felt here. I shall not return!

According to a lot of people that recommended us a place that was open late night, this was the place to go. I thought the food was aiight- nothing special. They are known for their carne asada, so I ordered two carne asada tacos. Their house made sauce was really good and spicy! Service was a little confusing because we didn't know that you can sit down and order before paying. They also gave us complimentary chips!

We just had the worse tacos and burritos ever! The meat was so hard and and they charge extra for everything! I will never go back there ever again! I grew up in Wicker Park and we've always bought tacos to go at LA PASADITA, but NOT ANYMORE! DO NOT GO TO LA PASADITA BY ASHLAND AND DIVISION!

Service:  Slow Food:  Extra ordinary.  Guac was just mashed up avocados. Workers:  Authentic and drinking tequila Burrito:  Poor There are way better places out there for mexican food...got to be better.

The naming convention of the two remaining La Pasadita restaurants (R.I.P. East side L.P.) is, in a word, puzzling.  On Yelp, the northern one (this one), is listed with "La Pasadita Restaurant" while the southern one is simply "La Pasadita".  This is puzzling because despite them both clearly being restaurants, the southern one was opened to provide more of the amenities of a classic restaurant, such as a wider variety of menu items and a full wait staff.  If one of these two were to receive the coveted and much ballyhooed "Restaurant" label, I would have imagined the southern one would be the obvious choice.  But the powers that be didn't see it the way I do, so we the people are left wonder why this decision was made.  If I were to list the 3 most intriguing mysteries known to man, they would be, in no particular order, the identity of the Lindbergh baby's kidnapper, the location of Jimmy Hoffa's body, and why the northern La Pasadita location was given the "Restaurant" suffix over its southern neighbor. If you want what La Pasadita is famous for, the carne asada, go here.  They have it down to a science. Seriously, hang out here when they whip up a large, fresh batch of steak tacos.  It's like watching Van Gogh paint (which I can say from personal experience is breathtaking).  But you owe it to yourself to try the chorizo tacos two doors down the street.
Best burritos,the meat is good,lots of flavor,once you try it you can just tell.

Twenty year ago, the tender juicy meat and the stingy salsa had you asking for more....not anymore. As a resident of this great city and a regular at La Pasadita, it is with sadness that I write this in how i have seen through the years the deterioration of their once 'best taco in town'. Everything is diferent now. The meat is not as tender and flavorful; the green salsa lacks flavor and consistency. And the place itself has become old. For me a trip to La Pasadita used to be a must in your day off. Now when I drive by, I know it's there and I can smell the grill meat...but it does not pull me in any longer.

Went there and had the carne asada nachos. The guacamole was very old, it was turning quite brown. The staff was eating lunch while preparing our food and we could hear the "ding" of microwaves going off and our food was brought out shortly after. It was not fresh at all. I had 2 chile relleno tacos, one was missing cheese and was soggy and dry, the other one had cheese but I could still tell it was not made fresh.  Thought we had found a really good spot for authentic Mexican food, but I will not go back here after this last round. Food was NOT fresh.

Directly across from the much much better one. The food is okay, but not of the same authentic quality and caliber as the greatest hole in the wall known to man directly across the street. This is good in a pinch though...definitely. Big stupendous sized burritos, but it just loses when there's a choice between that ridiculous deliciousness right across the street.
Best tacos de chile rellenos I've ever tasted. Love the horchata and the service.

I walked in for a quick lunch and to pass a few minutes before a meeting: no expectations. What I got was a first class vegetarian burrito, very fresh ingredients, made fast with courteous service. The decor is spartan but the prices can't be beat. Given that there are three locations in a half block span, it appears they have become something of a local institution, and rightfully so. Good inexpensive food served fast.

Is it the best Mexican food in Chicago? Probably not, but it doesn't pretend to be. Here's what you get at La Pasadita: great Mexican food, at a pretty reasonable price, open at all hours of the night. I always get the Super Burrito and I've never been disappointed. Yeah, the service is pretty bad and it gets pretty loud sometimes (although I admit going there after the Mexican soccer team played in Chicago was probably a poor choice on my part), but La Pasadita is more about hanging with friends and enjoying great food. They did increase their prices lately, but hey, can't really blame them, it's still pretty reasonable for what you get.

Garbage quality food and super expensive. $2.50 for a taco with no extra toppings? Cheese EXTRA, Sour cream EXTRA. I'm surprised they don't have a cover charge. Anyways,  the steak in both the tacos & burritos is tough, fatty and pretty much inedible. Like other reviewers have said, go to the taco places on Chicago & Ashland for better quality and cheaper prices.
Food is okay but the premises are caked with grease and dirt.  You can do much better.

I used to frequent La Pasadita ALL the time in my younger years after a night of heavy drinking. I have never been here sober, and I guess I wouldnt be opposed to it? I only go to the one that serves Chicken, for some strange reason the other two do not have chicken. I get the same thing every time, a Chicken burrito with extra cilantro. It is heavenly! I will definitely have to check them out sober sometime, but if you are in the mood for a burrito late night, this is your place!!!

Today was my second time to La Pasadita. Unfortunately I wasn't able to write an accurate review because my first time at LP was after some bar hopping. Today when we came back, I was once again impressed with the food at LP. I ordered the Chachos,which are basically nachos covered in beans, carne asada, guacamole,cheese and sour cream. Although the portion was huge they were delicious. Everyone else in my family loved their respective dishes and were raving about them the entire car ride home. Just beware that they are cash only!

Oh boy...here we go again. It's never easy to write a review where it seems like most others have a different opinion but that is the beauty of Yelp, right? I've been wanting to come here for a long time.  Perhaps that heightened my expectations (the long build-up) or the fact that most everyone raves about this place. As stated before, having 3 restaurants on the same street is bizarre but it didn't bother me. What did bother me is: #1:  They don't serve alcohol. I want a margarita with my food, dammit!  However, they are BYO so off to the liquor store we go.   #2:  The inside is dingy. I understand they originated in 1976 and apparently that means updates are not necessary. #3:  One of my favorite parts of eating at a Mexican restaurant is the chips and salsa. 2 BIG thumbs down for La Pasadita. The chips were too hard and the salsa is served in plastic squeeze bottles. Can you put it in a bowl for easy dipping? Can you make it fresh? #4:  I ordered the carne asada dinner. The meat came out sliced in tiny pieces and served with cooked onions. Um...isn't this fajitas? Typically, carne asada means ONE piece of meat. #5: Service is blah.  I had to remind the server 3 x for an extra cup for my beer. My co-diner had tacos and he liked them but agreed that this place does not reign supreme. I will say if I was hammered and it was 2 a.m., my impression may be different but aren't all at the time of night? :)

Decent quality charbroiled steak. However, they should advertise their tacos as mini tacos because they are tiny compared to other tacos joints.  Portion size does not justify la Pasadita charging $2.50 for each taco.  I also ordered the chicken tacos and they lacked flavor. Luckily they do serve the tacos with 2 different hot sauces that add flavor to the tacos. Decent food but there are better options in the area.

My co-worker recommended this place and I now call him the Taco God. The barbacoa beef taco is so good. I'm salivating now. Pull-apart beef. drool. The chile relleno (stuffed and fried chile) is super nice. The tacos are very minimal, meat, cilantro and onion on a corn tortilla. That's too simple for some people's special mouths, but I can't get enough.

Many people say they like the tacos here but I like the burritos. Believe it or not I haven't tried the tacos but obviously I must try them. The carne asada is the only meat to get. I don't know what they do to it. They must marinate it or something but I have never had anything like it. Correct me if I'm wrong but I think at the non express locations you can get more in your burrito than just onions and cilantro. Keep this in mind when choosing an express location versus a non express location. Unfortunately I won't give this place five stars because the decor is beyond bad. It is down right scary. Call me a snob but I have never eaten in the eating area. I won't even call it a dining room. Also the menu selection is limited.
Don't be fooled by the exterior of the building, this place serves the best steak tacos I've ever had. I try and go every time I'm in Chicago.

My favorite of all of the mexican joints on this strip, this has the largest variety of food and a good area to sit.  Also, you can get a couple of tacos for just a couple of bucks, or a huge feast for under 20 dollars.
Carne asada, onions, and cilantro on warmed tortillas.... the way taco are supposed to be made. Delicious!

SUPER LOVE!!! Eat in and carry out!!!!:) the steak is just seasoned to perfection! Orchatha is the best! Waiters are usually pretty cool... And I don't like the fact that they charge for pico di guelet ... It used to come with chips! Still love this place though.... It's good and not expensive... Not too healthy though.... But hey we're all gonna dye eventually anyway !!! Shrugged shoulders!!!:)
Best steak burrito I've ever had.  Go back every chance I get since we moved away from Chicago.

I have been going to this place for years for all those nights when the family didn't feel like cooking. I've had their taco salads, their tortas, burritos (and super burrito), and chip salad. Each was a delicious song and dance in my mouth. There's a bit of conversational, friendly feel to the place. I wouldn't consider this place first-date material, or anything really romantic, but it's a cozy enough place. The wait for food is a bit long and the parking could be better, but I find it to be worth it. Bring a friend over. You will not regret it.

Amazing, currently my favorite  steak burrito in Chicago.  I don't know what they do to the steak, but its soooo good.   Note, unless otherwise specified, the burritto and tacos only come with the meat and cilantro and onion.  If you want other topics like cheese, tomato, lettuce, guac., etc. you need to ask.

How are there so Many of these open with such S%$T% food? its not the cooks.. its the quality of there meat.. Its like they grapped Gum off the street. slapped it in a old Tortilla, sprinkled some grass on and said, here is your taco.. if you gave this polace 4-5 stars.. there is something wrong with your taste buds or maybe you just havent Ventured out another restaurant.
The best and most authentic tacos in all of Chicago. The steak tacos are amazing! A little lime juice on them, and you'll be hooked!!

Sorry, but this place is so overrated it makes my head spin. Everyone talks about the steak. It's more like a gristle and fat taco with a little steak thrown in. I can only assume all these people who give this place 5 stars must have been absolutely tanked when they ate there. Or perhaps it's because they monopolize the corner, and there really is no alternative. Head down to Chicago ave. You will find at least 4 better places within a couple of blocks.
Carne asada tacos, chips and guac. Sober or not delicious. Go-to taco place and there's like five of them on one block

Pretty good steak tacos. The barbacoa was kinda shitty man! I think they served me some peritoneum. As far as drunk food goes their steak tacos are on point but I have definitely had better. For steak tacos I hit up El Milagro.
Dry. Dry. Dry and tough beef. Over-hyped. The staff is lacking in motivation and care for their service and product. This is a place I want to like, but only the cilantro and hot sauce are fresh.

I'm on a perpetual quest for the perfect torta in Chicago.  So far, I haven't found a single torta that can hold a candle to El Famous Burrito in Vernon Hills (random, huh?), but The Dita will get the job done in a pinch.  I always go for the carne asada torta that includes beans, sour cream, tomatoes and guac.  Grab the green salsa and give your torta a nice douse of its yummy goodness.  You'll thank me later. La Pasadita gets an extra star for tolerating the influx of wasted Wicker Park folks that start to wander in at about 2am.  Obviously, since its open late and serves criminally cheap eats, its a target for the post-party crowd, but the servers and counter staff keep things moving quickly and their clientele under control.

Best effing Tostadas in Chicago. Get me a carne asada tostada and some horchata and I'm in heaven. It's cheap, delicious, fresh. Street parking, open late, next to a string of La Pasaditas. This is the only one I've been to because I chose it first, and could never bear to try the others when this one is already so damn good. I don't like the burritos though. Tried a torta and didn't like it either. But just come here and get a friggin tostada, or two.

Overpriced, few options, THEY USE MICROWAVES, bland salsa, tough flavorless meats. My boyfriend and I yelped a late night Mexican restaurant after checking out Lucha Va Voom (highly recommend).  We came upon this one and thought w/ the many reviews it would have to be somewhat good.  Wrong. The meat was super bland along with the only salsa they use - verde.  It was 95% water based.  The kicker was the fact they used microwaves for heating up the tortillas and maybe even the meat?   I say try any place but this one.

There are two places. Across the street from one another. I am curious about the difference between the two. It seems like it cannot be much seeing as this is your pretty typical Mexican fare. When I was here, it took a little while to get the server to the table. And we were starving -- so we accounted for that and decided that it took about 5 minutes after we sat ourselves to get attention. When we made the order, the food came out rather quickly. I had the chicken burrito and my dining partner had the same as tacos. Tasty. Did the job. Nothing incredibly remarkable. I heard their steak nachos are sinful, but I didn't get those this time. One thing I remember was the sauce. The green is a little spicy, but it's amazing. In all, a decent experience. Nothing incredible to write home about. Except the sauce. That was really good.

While I am not from Cali or Texas (people from those states are self-proclaimed mexican experts), I really really really liked this place.  The burrito shell was nice n lightly charred and filled with beefy goodness, and no cheese, no lettuce, no beans and no rice, and thank god, if I wanted that crap I coulda gone to Chipoltle.  The location was nice with a decent staff and awesome salsa.

I've been somewhat of a drunken, late night regular here and have seen two price increases in the last couple of years. I know about rising food prices and the inflationary dollar, but still me thinks it's about time to find a new neighborhood taco joint.

Perhaps you hear people say that "the best mexican food often comes from the most shit-hole of a place."  I couldn't agree more and LaPasadita proves it.   By no means am I saying that LaPasadita is a shit hole, but it certainly is greasy in there.  That said, we usually do take out.  Occassionally we dine in on a late night, which is another bonus. what can be better than late night greasy mexican food?! My favorite: Regular or Super steak taco  Chips with pico de gallo and guacamole Barbacoa (beef dinner plate) While my husband and I frequent this joint and love the food, I can only give it 3 stars for the lack of POW and WOW.  It's good mexican food, but oridinary.  I am certain there are other equally or better mexican joints in the chicagoland area, but again it's a local restaurant in my neighborhood.  I must support it.

I went to this location of Pasadita and I'm certain of it because I looked at the address on the way out.  I say this because there are 3 Pasaditas right there (one across the street and one next to this location). This location is hole in the wall, booths along the front across from the counter where you order, then in the back more tables and booths and a couple old video games. Menu is basic: carne asade, beef barbacoa, and tongue are the only meats available in taco or burrito form.  There's a couple more items but that's basically it.  So I got one of each taco with everything (everything =onions and cilantro) and some limonada. The food came out quick so that's a plus, however the tight parchment paper wrapping made the tortilla stick to the paper. The carne asada was a little tough but tasty.  The barbacoa was much more tender and also tasty, but messy.  The tongue was great.  It was cooked right so that it was tender and to me it seemed the most flavorful of the meats.  The salsa verde didn't really do anything for the tacos, so I could do with or without it.  The limonada definitely seemed Country Time to me, but it hit the spot anyway. Good place to get some quick beef tacos.  I've seen cheaper, but this place is by no means expensive.  I'd go again but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.
